Key Match Events: Derrick White scored 23 points and drilled six 3-pointers
Jayson Tatum scored 10 of his 20 points down the stretch of the first half
Payton Pritchard and Jrue Holiday totaled six 3-pointers and chipped in 20 and 14 points, respectively
Jalen Green led the Rockets with 27 points
Alperen Sengun added 14 points and seven rebounds
Miscellaneous Highlights: Houston could not keep pace while falling to 1-3 on its five-game homestand
Jabari Smith Jr., who broke his left (non-shooting) hand during shootaround earlier Friday, is scheduled to undergo surgery and is expected to be sidelined for four to eight weeks
Others: Boston made 19 of 39 3-point attempts and overwhelmed the Rockets with offensive precision
The Celtics — who played without Jaylen Brown (shoulder) — cruised to victory
Both teams were scorching early, shooting a combined 11 for 16 while Houston pushed to a 15-12 lead by the 7:29 mark of the first quarter
Boston extended to a 17-4 run and double-digit lead Houston shaved to 37-31 entering the second
Holiday scored 12 points on 5-of-6 shooting while Pritchard tallied 10 points off the bench in the first quarter
The Celtics shot 62.5 percent in the frame and made 7 of 12 3-pointers
Green tallied 11 points during a 14-6 spurt that shaved another double-digit deficit to 53-51
That’s when Tatum took over, recording two dunks and two 3-pointers over the final 2:53 of the half
Boston led 65-56 at the break. Pritchard, Tatum, White and Holiday combined for 51 points on 20-for-34 shooting including 11 of 20 from behind the arc. Boston committed one turnover in the first half
When Pitcher sank a 3-pointer with 8:43 remaining in the game, the Celtics led 93-72. Boston led by as many as 28 points in the final period
